Class Battle

  • java.lang.Object
    • Battle

  • public class Battle
extends java.lang.Object
    The Battle class represents a turn based battle between two armies using discretized versions of Lanchaster's equations. Each Battle is only complete when an army is completely destroyed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Battle(Army army1, Army army2)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isFinished()
      Returns boolean that describes whether the battle is finished or not.
      void step()
      Does one turn of the battle between the two armies.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the Battle object to String format by returning the statistics of both armies.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Battle

        public Battle(Army army1,
      Army army2)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        army1 - (required) Army object representing first army.
        army2 - (required) Army object representing second army.

    • Method Detail

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns boolean that describes whether the battle is finished or not.
        Returns:
        true if either of the armies are defeated

      • step

        public void step()
        Does one turn of the battle between the two armies. Uses the discretized version of Lanchaster's equations to inflict damage on each of the armies based on the current state.

        Does nothing if the battle is already finished.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the Battle object to String format by returning the statistics of both armies.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of the Battle object.
